column4: The process popularity-contest has the user »nobody«. What is the function of the »nobody« user?
It's a system user with lowered permissions.
Thank you. Using your information, I will continue my snooping.

it's like how some processes run as root, some also run as "nobody" because they don't need the elevated permissions. This way, if a service using it is compromised, an attacker only has the permissions of nobody instead of root
